sense.name: promotional material, promotional information content
sense.commentary: PUBLICITY[+entity][+abstract][+information][+promotional] Note: refers to information content, promotional message itself
sense.examples: They have started a new publicity campaign for this soft drink. The only publicity for his lecture are these fliers. Paying for publicity on television costs a lot more than on radio or newspaper.

sense.name: the state of being widely, publicly recognized, receiving attention
sense.commentary: PUBLICITY[+state][+social][+recognition][+public] Note: implies a social circumstance attributed to some individual
sense.examples: The publicity of the courtroom can be an unpleasant experience. The actress shied away from publicity in her later years. The senator has attracted a lot of unwelcome publicity in recent weeks.

sense.name: the business unit in charge of promotional material
sense.commentary: PUBLICITY[+entity][+social][+organization][+business_unit][+promotional] Note: refers to the organization responsible for creating promotional information
sense.examples: Take these photos downstairs to publicity. Who is head of the publicity department now in your firm?
